settings.title: Chefs At Home
settings.subtitle: Cooking inspiration from the home kitchens of your favorite chefs

settings.title: Our Mission
settings.text:
We work with artisanal fisherman and farmers who share our passion for premium, traceable seafood and are devoted to sustainability and the health of the oceans.

We love what we do, and we're transparent about our products and processes. The chefs we serve consider us a knowledgeable resource - and part of their team.

settings.title: Title
settings.content: Use this text to share information about your brand with your customers. Describe a product, share announcements, or welcome customers to your store.

settings.title_long: Since Sam Wulf opened his doors in 1926, we've been focused on providing the highest quality, best tasting fish available.

settings.title: Our Mission
settings.text: We work with artisanal fishermen and farmers who share our passion for premium, traceable seafood and are devoted to sustainability and the health of the oceans. We love what we do, and we’re transparent about our products and processes. The chefs we serve consider us a knowledgeable resource – and part of their team.
settings.text_2:
We know our fish, because we oversee our supply chain, from offload to kitchen.

We cultivate trusted relationships with fishermen, divers, and experts across the globe who are as obsessed with quality and transparency as we are. At Wulf’s, we offer only the highest-grade fish and specialty seafood, humanely sourced and hand-selected daily.
settings.text_3:
Every morning, Sam Wulf would walk the Boston Fish Pier before sunrise, wearing his trademark white shirt and tie. When it came to procuring premium product, the man was ruthless, and local fishermen knew better than to try to sell him anything less than the best. He would return to his shop with the freshest whole fish, and clean and cut it by hand.

Two generations later, Wulf’s Fish has grown into a national brand, but that same obsession for quality still drives everything we do, from where we source our fish to how we cut and deliver it. We continue to buy directly from our fishermen and partners, creating a uniquely transparent customer experience. Traceability is at the core of everything we do. And 90 years later, we’re still based in Boston, but we’ve expanded our reach to deliver the highest quality product – anywhere.

We think Sam would approve.

settings.title: We're headquartered in the heart of Boston's Seaport District, and we ship our products across the country.
settings.content_text:
Retail customers can reach us via live chat or at 1-888-WULFPAK Monday - Friday, 9 am - 5 pm ET.

Wholesale customers can reach us at 857-991-1557 Monday - Saturday 7 am - 3 pm ET.

settings.title: We're headquartered in the heart of Boston's Seaport District, and we ship our products across the country.
Heading
settings.text: Text area can be used for details about blog authors or general information.

settings.not_found_text:
We're sorry, but the page you requested could not be found.

Try searching or continue shopping.

settings.title: Can I add to an order I’ve already placed?
settings.answer:
Yes, if you've already placed an order, you can add to it by placing a second order and using code: ADDON at checkout to avoid an additional delivery fee. 

Please send a note to customercare@wulfsfish.com with the order numbers you are combining. 

Items can be added to your order until the midnight order cut-off the day before they go out for local express delivery or shipping.

settings.title: Can I make changes to my order?
settings.answer:
ALL orders are final sales. If you need to make ANY changes to the content of the order or delivery method, this must be done the night before your order is scheduled to ship.

To request a change: email customercare@wulfsfish.com and please be sure to reference your order number. Once orders are packed, we cannot make any additional changes.

settings.title: Do you ship nationally?
settings.answer: Yes! We ship to the 48 contiguous states through the site. Shipping charges, and free shipping minimums, via UPS/ FedEx are calculated by zones. Options for your area will be automatically calculated at checkout. Shipping to Alaska, Hawaii and Puerto Rico by special arrangement. Email customercare@wulfsfish.com for a quote.

settings.title: Custom shipping requests
settings.answer:
We may be able to accommodate custom shipping requests, like expedited delivery, for an additional fee. Contact us at customercare@wulfsfish.com

Please provide your zip code and a possible estimate of your order in your email so we can get the most accurate custom quote for you.

settings.title: I live in the Seaport or nearby. Why can’t I pick up from your warehouse?
settings.answer: Currently, our staff is dedicated and focused on buying, cutting, packaging and preparing your orders for delivery. We are not able to set up a Seaport pick up right now.

settings.title: When will my order arrive?
settings.answer: Local Express Delivery orders arrive next day, Monday – Friday, from when they were placed. If you are receiving your order via FedEx/UPS, orders ship Monday - Wednesday, and you will receive tracking info on the day of shipping. Your order will arrive in 1-3 days. FedEx/UPS does not offer specific delivery times.

settings.title: Is your packaging eco-friendly?
settings.answer: Yes! Making sustainable choices and minimizing waste is part of everything we do and using eco-friendly shipping materials is top of our list. Our Wulf’s shipping boxes and insulated liners are made with plant-based renewable materials and are 100% curbside recyclable with your other paper recycling.

settings.title: What if my order arrives partially defrosted?
settings.answer:
Orders are packed in an insulated box with dry ice, gel packs, and a temperature indicator for your safety. If the seafood arrives partially thawed, it is safe to store in your freezer upon receipt.

If you have questions or concerns, please contact customercare@wulfsfish.com

settings.title: How do I dispose of the dry ice?
settings.answer:
Dry ice is extremely cold and must be handled carefully.  

DO NOT touch it with bare hands. Use a towel or oven mitt to handle it and put it aside while unpacking your cooler. 

DO NOT eat it or add it to drinks. 

DO NOT store it in a working refrigerator or freezer.  

DO NOT leave dry ice on countertops since the extreme cold can cause damage and cracking to the surfaces. 

DO NOT leave dry ice unattended around children or pets. 

DO allow dry ice to melt and turn into a gas, then dispose of the packaging.

settings.title: Can I add to a subscription order?
settings.answer:
If you want more seafood delivered beyond what's in your subscription, it's now even easier to Add On with our new, streamlined interface.

Log on to your account page at wulfsfish.com

Navigate to "My Subscriptions"

Click on the button in the top right of your screen called "Add a Product"

From there you will be able to add an item to be delivered with your subscription. Either search for the item in the search bar or scroll the pop-up menu for items to add. With this new interface, there's no need to add code "Add On" or send a separate note to Customer Care to flag the addition.

You can now add items as one-time purchases or as recurring additions to your subscription. If an item can be added on a recurring basis, the subscription option will be visible on that item.  

You are always free to pause or cancel your subscription at any time without penalty. Log in to your account to update your preferences. 

Need help Contact customercare@wulfsfish.com for assistance or through the chat button on our website.

settings.title: How do I make my own subscription?
settings.answer:
Now it's easy to get all your favorites set to deliver to your door every 30 days, and with just a few clicks.

Here's how you do it:

Shop on our online store as you usually would. Items that are available for subscription will have that option clearly marked.  

Just choose "Subscribe" then "Add to Cart" and continue shopping as usual. All the items you subscribe to in your order will be bundled together into a custom subscription that will automatically ship to you every 30 days. Your credit card will be charged when the order ships out each month.

Shipping will not be charged if your subscription meets the FREE Shipping minimum for your zone. See our shipping zone chart.

Add seasonal items when you want them. Due to seasonality and limited availability, we cannot offer subscriptions on all items, but it's easy to add seasonal specialties to ship with your subscription as they become available.

You are always free to pause or cancel your subscription at any time without penalty. Log in to your account to update your preferences.

settings.title: How do I skip a month of my subscription?
settings.answer:
To manage your subscription, log in to your account. (Even if you are a subscriber, you must create an account to be able to manage your subscription.) Once you are logged in, click on “Manage Subscription.” From there you can skip a delivery or make other modifications to your account.  

If you have trouble managing your account online, please contact customer service via phone, chat or at CustomerCare@wulfsfish.com and someone will assist you.

settings.title: How should I defrost my fish?
settings.answer:
Properly defrosted super-frozen fish tastes just like fresh. Honestly. We tried it ourselves, and we're really fussy. Remove the seafood from the packaging and defrost product in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours before use. (Small items like poke and shrimp will defrost faster while large cuts can take longer.) Do not defrost at room temperature or in water. Flavor and texture are lost this way. Once fully defrosted, use within three days. It is not recommended to refreeze fully thawed product. 

Caviar will defrost quickly at room temperature and may be consumed immediately. Some of our pantry items will not arrive frozen and can be consumed immediately and used within the timeframe specified.

settings.title: What if my order arrives partially defrosted?
settings.answer: Orders are packed in an insulated box with dry ice and a temperature indicator for your safety. If the seafood arrives partially thawed, it is safe to store in your freezer upon receipt. It is not recommended to refreeze fully thawed product, although that seafood is safe for consumption if the temperature indicator registers that the box has remained at a safe temperature in transit.

settings.title: My seafood arrived defrosted. How do I know if it’s safe to eat?
settings.answer: We endeavor to pack all orders to arrive completely frozen, but high outdoor temperatures can be challenging. All orders that ship via FedEx or UPS contain a temperature indicator so you can rest assured that your order has kept a safe temperature in transit. If the lower box on your card is WHITE, your seafood is safe and has maintained a safe temperature in transit. If the lower box in your temperature indicator card is BLUE, please contact Wulf’s. Your seafood may have reached an unsafe temperature.

settings.title: Is your seafood sushi grade?
settings.answer:
Sushi grade is not a technical term. It refers to the freshness and quality of seafood. (For more on what this means, read our Ask a Fishmonger entry on the subject.)

If you've eaten at a high-end restaurant in Boston, there's a very good chance that you've already eaten some of our fish raw in a sushi or crudo. We sell that same quality and freshness to home cooks in our online store.

The most important thing to note for consuming raw fish at home is that lots can go wrong in the kitchen! To keep raw fish safe, it must be properly defrosted under refrigeration. You must keep the seafood scrupulously cold and all surfaces that come in contact with the raw fish (knife, cutting board, countertop) clean and sanitized to avoid cross-contamination. Some find this too stressful and decide to leave raw seafood prep to the professionals. Some home cooks are prepared for the challenge, and safely enjoy sashimi, poke and ceviche at home.

settings.title: Why do you sell only frozen seafood?
settings.answer:
All orders for Home Delivery have been vacuum packed and super-frozen. We do this because we believe it’s the best way to give you the highest quality product, preserved at peak freshness and available on your schedule. Compared to taking a piece of fish and freezing it in your home freezer, super-freezing is superior in every measure of taste and texture. You can read more about this here.


There are also serious environmental benefits with frozen seafood, especially reduced food waste.  Freezing a product at its best means it’s ready when you are and not left spoiling behind a seafood counter or in your fridge. Not letting fish go to waste is the most responsible way of conserving the resource so we can eat seafood for years to come.

settings.title: You already like previously frozen fish. You just don’t know it.
settings.answer:
Frozen fish gets a bad rap because the fish that is often frozen wasn’t that great to begin with, but if you’ve eaten sushi, you’ve eaten previously frozen fish. 

Many states legally require that fish be frozen before being served raw to eliminate any potential parasites. Top sushi restaurants are serving great fish that’s been previously super-frozen — just like we do it.

settings.title: Our Freezer is Better than Yours.
settings.answer: Freezing seafood with a specialized commercial blast freezer and freezing it at home give very different outcomes. Our process is called “Super Freezing” this freezes fish quickly and to a much lower temperature than a conventional freezer, and the taste and texture of the fish are impeccably preserved this way.

settings.title: Want the technical details on super freezing?
settings.answer:
OK. The way that these freezers work is connected to the way that water freezes within the cells of the fish. As the water molecules within the cells of the fish start to freeze, they move toward other molecules to form specific patterns. When the molecules pull away from the cells, they leave higher concentrations of enzymes and electrolytes that damage the cell walls. If the freeze time is slow (like in a home freezer), this movement can damage the cells much more than it would during a super freeze because of the large size of the ice crystals. When they freeze quickly, the molecules don’t have time to reposition themselves and smaller crystals form. Large clumps of ice don’t develop, and the enzymes and electrolytes stay isolated, causing less damage to the cells.

With super freezing, a thawed product closely resembles the fresh version in taste, color, texture and even the nutrients that are locked in.

settings.gallery-title: Read more reviews from real customers, and leave one of your own, on Trustpilot.

settings.title: FROZEN IS FRESH (AND SUSTAINABLE)
settings.text:
With super freezing, a thawed product closely resembles the fresh version in taste, color, texture and even the nutrients that are locked in. 

All orders for Home Delivery have been individually vacuum packed and super-frozen. We do this because we believe it’s the best way to give you the highest quality product, preserved at peak freshness and available on your schedule.   

There are also serious environmental benefits with frozen seafood, especially reduced food waste.  Freezing a product at its best means it’s ready when you are and not left spoiling behind a seafood counter or in your fridge. Preventing waste is the most responsible way of conserving the resource so we can eat seafood for years to come.

Large clumps of ice don’t develop, and the enzymes and electrolytes stay isolated, causing less damage to the cells.

THAWING

Defrosting your seafood

Remove the seafood from the packaging and defrost the product in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours before use. (Small items like poke and shrimp will defrost faster while large cuts can take longer.) 

Do not defrost at room temperature. Once defrosted, use within three days. Caviar will defrost quickly at room temperature and may be consumed immediately.

settings.content_text: Seafood can be confusing, and a bit mysterious. Bring us your questions! If we choose your question to answer on our blog, we’ll send you a code for 10% off your next order.

settings.title: Eat Well. Get Rewarded. Repeat.
settings.title2: Join The Chef's Table rewards program and earn points toward even more great seafood.
settings.text: You'll earn points with every purchase in our online store, and even for telling your friends about Wulf's. Plus, Chef's Table members get special access to new products and specially curated gifts. Become a member. It's easy and free! Get 500 points just for signing up.

settings.description: Earn points with every purchase in our online store, and even for telling your friends about Wulf's Fish.
Get members-only access to products, special gifts, and even bonus points for your birthday.
Spend your points on any purchase in our store, from everyday favorites to our finest caviars.

settings.title: One dollar = one point
settings.text: Earn 500 points just for signing up. Then, earn 1 point for every dollar spent at wulfsfish.com to start, and up to 4 points per dollar at the Executive Chef level. Earn bonus points for following Wulf's on social media, referring your friends, your birthday, and when you reach the next membership tier.

settings.title: 500 points = 10 dollars
settings.text: Redeem your points for anything in our store and save on the seafood you love. Members also enjoy perks like special gifts, insider information, and special access to chefs only products at the Chef de Cuisine and Executive Chef levels.

settings.title: How do I sign up?  What if I already have an account?
settings.answer: If you have a store account, you are automatically enrolled in The Chefs Table. You don’t need to do anything to participate. Your signup bonus of 500 points will be automatically added to your account. If you do not yet have an account, it’s easy and free to sign up.

settings.title: How many points do I need to start redeeming them?
settings.answer: The minimum balance that may be redeemed is 500 points.

settings.title: How do I redeem my points?
settings.answer: Log in to your Chef's Table account. Select All Rewards from the main menu. The value of the points you are able to redeem will appear. Choose from the menu how many points you would like to redeem. A discount code will be generated that you can copy and paste into the discount code field at checkout. When you add the code, the value of the points will be deducted from your cart total and recorded as spent in your account. Redeeming points cannot be added to additional promotional offers or used simultaneously with discount codes.

settings.title: How do I move to the next membership tier?
settings.answer: Membership levels are based on purchase amounts made within a calendar year. In addition to purchases, you can earn points by liking Wulf’s on social media and sharing with your friends, as well as bonus points for your birthday and ascending to a new membership tier. Points do not expire at the end of the calendar.

settings.title: Do points expire?
settings.answer: Points will begin to expire 1 year (365 days) from the date of enrollment. After this date, all unredeemed points will expire on a rolling basis for customers who have not engaged in points activity for 1 year (365 days) or more.

settings.title: How do I see my points balance?
settings.answer: In your Chef's Table account profile you will be able to see your points balance and your full points activity history.

settings.title: How do I get my gift when I move to the next membership tier?
settings.answer: You will get an email with a coupon code for the FREE gift which you can redeem at your next order.

settings.title: How will I get my birthday points?
settings.answer: Once you have an account, add your birthday to your Chef's Table profile. On your birthday, your points bonus will be automatically added to your account. You must add your birthday to your profile at least 30 days before the date for birthday points to be awarded.

settings.faq_description: The Chef's Table is the rewards program of Wulf's Fish. Rewards are redeemable at wulfsfish.com and may not be exchanged for cash.

settings.title: Log in to your account
settings.additional_info: Creating an account automatically enrolls you in our Chef's Table Rewards Program.

settings.text:
Wulf's Fish is a boutique seafood company serving top restaurants and passionate home cooks across the country. We source only the best seafood, handle it meticulously, and cut fish by hand with an old school attention to detail and service. 

The current company grew out of a beloved Brookline fish market started in 1926. Our chef customers are just as obsessed with quality as we are, and they range from multi-Michelin starred chefs working every day to maintain and exceed their own high standards, to up-and-coming independent chef-operators striving to make their mark on the world. In spring 2020, we launched an online store and home delivery service, selling to home cooks the same top-quality products usually reserved for chefs.

As an affiliate, you can earn money promoting and driving sales for Wulf's Fish.

Commissions start at 12% of all sales generated by the links you place on your website or social media posts.
settings.text_2:
How Does It Work?

When you join our Affiliate Program, you will have access to a range of banners and unique tracking links that can be placed within your website, blog, social media posts or email. When a user clicks on one of those links, they will be brought to our website and their activity will be tracked by the IMPACT platform.

For each sale made through your links, a commission will be earned based on your commission level.

How Much Do I Get Paid and When?

Commissions start at 12% of sales-All sales you make are tracked for 30 days. Payments are made monthly net 30 for the previous month.

Ready to join?

The Wulf's Fish Affiliate Program is managed via the Impact platform. Please click here to join now.

Still Have Questions?

If you still have questions, please contact us at affiliate@wulfsfish.com and we will get right back to you.

settings.title: SHARE YOUR LOVE OF GREAT SEAFOOD. GIVE $15 OFF. GET $15 OFF..
settings.button_1: Join The Chef's Table to Refer a Friend

settings.title: Tell your seafood loving friends about Wulf's and you both save
settings.text:
Refer a friend to Wulf's, and we'll give them $15 off their first order. When they shop with Wulf's, we’ll send you a code for $15 off your next order. 

To refer a friend, you must be a member of our rewards program The Chef's Table. Sign up is easy and free.

In addition to being able to refer your friends, as a member of The Chef's Table, you'll have access to special perks and earn points for every dollar you spend. 

Referral discounts are valid on order or $100 or more and can not be combined with other offers. Referral invitations expire 30 days after sending.

settings.title: CUSTOMER SERVICE LEAD (E-COMM.)
settings.richtext:
The Role
Wulf’s Fish is seeking a customer service lead for our e-commerce division. This is a great opportunity to be part of a young division with a small team and a strong growth plan. At Wulf’s, we carefully select and butcher by hand the fish we sell, and we’re committed to offering the highest quality available. We’re a hands-on company doing much more than buying and selling products we never touch, and we’re very serious about food and cooking here!

The customer service lead will work in coordination with the e-commerce production and marketing teams to answer incoming customer questions, troubleshoot order and shipping issues, and chat with home cooks about the products we sell and the best way to handle and prepare their seafood.

Customer support is a critical part of the Wulf’s brand, and we pride ourselves on offering attentive and informed assistance to our home cook e-commerce customers. The customer service lead will also bring insights from their customer interactions to help shape messaging, develop new products, and improve systems throughout the division.

The ideal candidate will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines. They must also bring their culinary knowledge and be excited to talk about food and cooking. They will bring their enthusiasm and creativity every day to help build the Wulf’s Fish brand in Boston and beyond.


Responsibilities
Answer incoming customer questions by chat, phone and email and stay engaged with the customer until the issue is resolved.

Engage with customer questions and issues via Facebook, Instagram and Trustpilot reviews.

Troubleshoot order and delivery issues until they are resolved.

Participate in bi-weekly meetings to discuss new products and promotions.

Work with the production team to have order paperwork prepared for shipment.

Communicate with the marketing team on user experience issues on the website and in promotions.  

Attend occasional live events with the public to promote Wulf’s Fish.
 

Qualifications
Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with a thick skin and a great sense of humor.

Must be self-motivated with an entrepreneurial mindset.

Must be a detail-oriented and customer-focused multi-tasker.

Able to communicate clearly and concisely over the phone and through live chat and email.

Customer focused: proactively seek and find ways to provide the highest standards of service. Repeat customers and word of mouth marketing are key to the success of the division.

Knowledge of seafood and cooking is strongly desired. Our culinary knowledge and engagement are part of what sets Wulf’s apart. We love to talk about fish and cooking, and so do our customers.

Previous knowledge of, or willingness to learn, Shopify and Skuvault.


Commitment  
This is a full-time position  

Will work from our office in Boston’s Seaport District. This is not a remote position.  

Paid time off, medical and dental benefits  

Company Sponsored 401K with match

Work schedule is Monday – Friday, 9 am- 5 pm
 

To apply
Please send a resume and cover letter to alumea@wulfsfish.com

Please tell us about your experience in customer service, hospitality, or a role working with the public as well as your culinary knowledge. Experience cooking seafood would be a big plus!

settings.title: Digital Growth Marketing Manager
settings.richtext:
The Role

Wulf’s Fish is seeking a Digital Growth Marketing Manager for our e-commerce division. This is a great opportunity to help build a young division of a legacy company.

The ideal candidate will have an analytic mind, a love for finding answers and inspiration in data, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines. They will bring their insights and creativity every day to help build the Wulf’s Fish ecommerce business in Boston and beyond.

As the Digital Growth Marketing Manager, you will scale efficient customer acquisition to meet our ambitious growth goals. Reporting to the Director of Marketing, you’ll own end-to-end strategy for our paid campaigns across social, search, and display while working with the team to refine and optimize the customer journey.

You will work collaboratively as part of the marketing team and with our external tech team.

·       Implement and manage every aspect of our paid digital media spend. Work with marketing colleagues on strategy and creative for campaigns to efficiently drive brand awareness, interest, and new customer acquisition.

·       Develop & execute SEO strategies to grow the share of organic traffic. Collaborate with marketing colleagues to continuously optimize content for SEO and conversions.

·       Use Shopify and Google Analytics tools to assess the customer journey. Strategize and test ways to improve it for increased conversions.

·       Drive revenue, achieve targeted ROI and CAC and maintain positive KPI trends; Determine monthly, quarterly and annual revenue forecasts and ad budgets.

·       Report weekly on cross-channel performance.

·       Conduct deep-dive marketing performance analysis across multiple programs such as email, paid search, affiliates, and other initiatives to optimize ROI of campaigns.

·       Obsessively experiment, optimize, and test new channels. Make recommendations to the team for new channels and strategies.


Qualifications

·       5+ years of experience in relevant paid media channels focused on conversion and rapid growth through new customer acquisition.

·       Proven marketer who understands and has worked across the full DTC marketing funnel.

·       Familiarity with performance tracking, measurement, and attribution. Demonstrated experience with platforms, technology and online marketing tools for managing and scaling paid marketing channels.

·       Highly analytical and strategic thinker able to turn data into actionable campaigns.

·       Detail-oriented and self-motivated problem-solver. Someone who is excited by helping develop structure around something new. This is a new role for the company.

·       Ideal candidate has experience with subscription models as well as a la carte purchases.

·       Always looking for the latest innovation or approach.

·       Expertise with a wide range of acquisition channels (SEO, paid social, email, referrals, search, dynamic product ads, native advertising, etc.) and experience driving campaigns across each of them.


This is a full-time salaried position based in our Boston office.

Benefits include: Paid time off, Medical, dental and vision, 401K 

To Apply

Please send a cover letter and resume to Alisha Lumea, alumea@wulfsfish.com

settings.title: E-commerce Customer Success Manager
settings.richtext:
The Role 

Wulf’s Fish is seeking an e-commerce customer success manager to help guide the end-to-end experience for home cook customers. The job will consist of multiple functions: customer service and success, marketing and production liaison and online manager and of the store, and (ideally) brand chef for culinary content and development. 

This is a great opportunity to be part of a young division with a small team and a strong growth plan. At Wulf’s, we carefully select and butcher by hand the fish we sell, and we’re committed to offering the highest quality available. We’re a hands-on company doing much more than buying and selling products we never touch, and we’re very serious about food and cooking here! 

The ideal candidate will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines. They must also bring their culinary knowledge and be excited to talk about food and cooking.  

This role would be a great next step for someone looking to leave the restaurant kitchen who would like to build out their skill set for a different kind of job in food. It would also be a good fit for someone early in their career in marketing or customer service who would like to expand their skill set and get a more complete picture of how a food business works.  

 

Responsibilities 

Customer Service (40%)  

Manage customer interactions through the Gorgias platform the integrates chat, emails and social media comments. The e-commerce manager will own this platform through customer interactions and reviewing issues with colleagues to find solutions to recurring problems in production, shipping or communications.   

Respond to customer phone calls and record those calls in Gorgias so issues can be tracked accurately. 

Implement tagging of messages by categories and communicate issues and issue frequency to the team as needed to facilitate improvement.  

Stay engaged with the customer until the issue is resolved. Troubleshoot order and delivery issues as needed. 

Record and give voice to user experience issues on the website and in promotions. Work with marketing to troubleshoot and resolve them. 

Attend occasional live events with the public to promote Wulf’s Fish. 

 

Online Store Management (40%) 

Liase with the production team to make sure all product information is correct and up to date. It changes frequently and requires diligent checking and double-checking. 

Trouble shoot issues in Shopify and Skuvault as the arise to make sure inventory is properly recorded. 

Work with the marketing team to write new product descriptions for the store and update existing descriptions to reflect changes in format, seasonality, or a new idea on how to better merchandise the product. 

Participate in decisions on adding new products, the timing of promotions, and how best to highlight products. Help write copy as needed. 

Generate reports in Shopify on product sales to help guide new product and promotion decisions.  

Serve as an additional editor for the online store by looking for and correcting broken links and outdated information as needed. 

Participate in bi-weekly meetings to discuss new products and promotions, as well as daily real-time discussions with team members. 

Participate in writing campaign and flow content for customer newsletter communications in coordination with marketing colleagues. 

 

Brand Chef (20%) Finding someone with professional cooking experience would be ideal, but we are open to candidates who are not able to fulfill the brand chef aspect of the role. 

New product evaluation and culinary brainstorming on how to sell the item. 

Recipe creation and food styling for the website and social media content creation in coordination with marketing colleagues.  

Writing tasting notes and cooking tips for products.  

Leading online or in-person cooking classes on occasion as opportunities can be created independently by Wulf’s or with partners.  

 

Qualifications 

Experience working with the public in a customer service, hospitality or retail role. Professional food experience desired. A passion for the topic of food and cooking required. 

Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with a thick skin and a great sense of humor. 

Must be self-motivated with an entrepreneurial mindset.  

Must be willing to interrogate every process and product for continuous improvement and bring creativity and a hands-on approach to making change. 

Must be a detail-oriented and customer-focused multi-tasker. Time management and the ability to set and complete tasks is key to success in this role. 

Able to communicate clearly and concisely over the phone and in writing. 

Strong writing skills with the ability to write in a variety of tones/styles to suit different communications needs, from diplomatically dealing with a customer to conversational kitchen tips to promote a product. 

Customer focused: proactively seek and find ways to provide the highest standards of service. Repeat customers and word of mouth marketing are key to the success of the division. 

Knowledge of seafood and cooking required. Our culinary knowledge and engagement are part of what sets Wulf’s apart. We love to talk about fish and cooking, and so do our customers. 

Previous knowledge of, or willingness to learn, Shopify, Skuvault, Gorgias, Klaviyo and Asana. 

 

Commitment  

This is a full-time position  

Will work from our office in Boston’s Seaport District. This is not a remote position.  

Paid time off, medical and dental benefits  

Company Sponsored 401K with match 

Work schedule is Monday – Friday, 9 am- 5 pm with occasional evening and weekend hours for special events.

This role will be located within the marketing department and liaise with production and wholesale teams. 

 

To apply 

Please send a resume and cover letter to alumea@wulfsfish.com 

Please tell us about your experience in customer service, hospitality, or a role working with the public as well as your culinary knowledge. Experience cooking seafood would be a big plus!

settings.title: SEAFOOD INSIDE SALES ASSOCIATE
settings.richtext:
The Role
Work alongside the existing sales team to provide outstanding customer service and engagement with customers. Our ideal candidate will always uphold the ideals of our company while constantly striving to generate sales. Must be able to think on their feet and problem solve quickly throughout the day as the seafood industry is constantly changing. Attention to detail is a must. Saturday shifts will be required. 

Qualifications
Must be fluent in English, able to read and write.

Must have a valid drivers license.

Great communication & computer skills are a must.

Must be proficient in Microsoft office suite.

Experience in seafood and/or sales not required.

We are willing to train the right candidate. 

Commitment 

This is a full-time salaried position plus commission.

Will work from our office at in Boston’s Seaport District 

Paid time off, medical and dental benefits, 401K 

To Apply
Please send your resume & at least two references by email to Jobs@wulfsfish.com.

Please include an answer to these two questions:
– What makes you interested in working in seafood?
– Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position?

settings.title: Customer and Sales Support Associate (Wholesale division)
settings.richtext:
The Role  

Wulf’s Fish is seeking a Customer and Sales Support Associate to help manage customer relationships and expectations in our wholesale division. This role will act as a liaison with existing customers and vendors. The job will consist of multiple functions: communications between Wulf’s Fish and our current customer base, communications between the account manager and customers, as well as assisting with daily activities in the sales office such as invoicing, data entry, and managing some aspects of shipping. This is a great opportunity to be part of a small team with a strong growth plan. At Wulf’s Fish, we carefully select and butcher by hand the fish we sell, and we’re committed to offering the highest quality available. We’re a hands-on company doing much more than buying and selling products we never touch, and we’re very serious about food and cooking here!  

The ideal candidate will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines. They must also bring their culinary knowledge and be excited to talk about food and cooking.   

This role would be a great next step for someone looking to leave the restaurant kitchen who would like to build out their skill set for a different kind of job in food. It would also be a good fit for someone early in their career in sales or customer service who would like to expand their skill set and get a more complete picture of how a food business works.   

The Customer and Sales Support Associate will work in coordination with the existing Sales team to continue to grow our customer base and increase sales. The Customer and Sales Support Associate role is a critical part of the Wulf’s brand, and we pride ourselves on offering not only the best seafood, but the best relationships which come with attentive service and informed assistance to our customers. The Customer and Sales Support Associate will also bring insights from their customer interactions to help Sales Mangers grow their existing customers. 

We will be hiring more than one person for this role, and we are looking for people to fill both day and evening/night shifts. Some weekend hours are required.

Responsibilities  

Customer Service (40%)   

Manage customer interactions through the shared ordering email and order confirmations.    

Respond to customer phone calls, questions, and provide thoughtful suggestions on potential replacement items when we face product outages.  

Implement order changes or adds with production team.  

Stay engaged with the customers to resolve any potential shortfalls with products to ensure every effort is made to fulfil an order in full.  

 

Support Sales Managers (40%)  

Liaise with the sales managers to learn details about each individual customer, ordering specs, delivery details, and proper flows of communications.  

Troubleshoot issues with orders, assist with clarifying specs, with the help of managers to ensure customer needs are being met.   

Work with the sales managers to highlight specific products, or suggest potential product upsells where appropriate.  

Assisting with price management. 

  

Sales Daily Operations (20%)  

Transcribing orders from email to paper. 

Inputting orders from paper to QuickBooks. 

Invoicing orders / creating BOL’s / Shipping documents etc.  

  

Qualifications  

Experience working with the public in a customer service, hospitality, or retail role. Professional food experience desired.  A passion for seafood is a must.  

Exceptional organizational and communication skills, with thick skin and an enthusiastic sense of humor.  

Must be self-motivated with an entrepreneurial mindset.   

Must be willing to interrogate every process and product for continuous improvement and bring creativity and a hands-on approach to making change.  

Must be a detail-oriented and customer-focused multi-tasker. Time management and the ability to set and complete tasks is key to success in this role.  

Able to communicate clearly and concisely over the phone and in writing.  

Customer focused: proactively seek and find ways to provide the highest standards of service.  

Knowledge of seafood is required. Our culinary knowledge and engagement are part of what sets Wulf’s apart. We love to talk about fish and so do our customers.  

Previous knowledge of, or willingness to learn, QuickBooks, Seasoft, and Excel.  

  

Commitment   

This is a full-time position (although part-time is possible for the right candidate)

Multiple shifts available - day and evening/night. Some weekend hours are required.   

Will work from our office in Boston’s Seaport District. This is not a remote position.  

Free Parking  

Paid time off, medical, dental, and vision benefits 

Company Sponsored 401K with match  

Employee discount program  

Dining allowance 

  

To apply  

Please send a resume and cover letter to Dantczak@wulfsfish.com  

Please tell us about your experience in customer service, sales, or a role working in hospitality as well as your seafood knowledge. Experience cooking seafood would be a big plus!

settings.title: Driver
settings.richtext:
The Role  

Wulf’s Fish is looking for friendly and hardworking individuals to join our Seafood Delivery Team. The daily routine typically includes but is not limited to: handling product, delivering to our restaurant customers throughout Massachusetts, and dropping ground and air freight.  

Qualifications  

Valid driver’s license and insurable driving record (No CDL required) 

Comfortable driving delivery vans, experience driving box trucks a plus 

Accountable and able to communicate effectively with co-workers and customers 

Strong attention to detail and an ability to retain new information 

Must be able to work on your feet and lift 50 lbs 

Experience with seafood and/or kitchen work is valuable but not required; we will teach the right candidate  

Commitment  

This is a full-time job.   

Must be willing to work when needed (6 days).  

Multiple shifts/starting times available but 8 hrs per shift expected. 

Benefits 

Generous Paid Time Off Policy 

Matching 401K  

Medical, Vision and Dental coverage 

Discounts on all in-house seafood for home use 

To Apply 

Call or text Rich Maldonado at 617.708.2063 

Email a resume or summary of recent work experience and any relevant skills or abilities to jobs@wulfsfish.com

settings.title: Fish Cutter — Full-Time
settings.richtext:
The Role 

Wulf’s Fish is seeking an experienced fish cutter to join our team. 

 Qualifications 

Experience cutting all types of fish preferred. 

Attention to detail and the quality of your work is a must. 

Experience in all phases of shipping and packing is a plus. 

Must be willing to perform other warehouse tasks as needed. We are a small shop, and everyone pitches in to get the job done. 

Must be able to work on your feet and lift 50 lbs.  

Commitment 

This is a full-time job.  

Must be willing to work when needed (6 days). 

Must be able to start work early in the morning (5:30 or 6 AM).  

To Apply 

Call or text Bala at 857.615.5559

settings.title: Current Job Openings
settings.subtitle: We’re always looking for talented and committed individuals with a passion for seafood. If you’re interested in being part of our team, we want to hear from you.

settings.title: The best chefs in the nation trust Wulf's Fish
settings.trustpilot: Trustpilot

settings.header_info:
Welcome back! Your account page is where you can check your order status, manage your address and payment information, check your Chef's Table rewards balance, and manage any subscriptions.

Can't find what you're looking for? Contact us through live chat or at customercare@wulfsfish.com.

settings.title: The best chefs in the nation trust Wulf's Fish
settings.trustpilot: Trustpilot

settings.description: We source only the highest quality seafood from New England and around the world, handle it meticulously, and cut fish by hand so nothing but the best arrives at your kitchen door.
From New York to Napa, our premium products are delivered daily to the nation's best restaurants. We're proud to offer only the highest quality seafood to high-end chefs and home cooks alike.
Meeting our customers' needs and exceeding their expectations is central to our mission. The customers we serve consider us a knowledgeable resource – and part of their team.

settings.pretext:
"I'm continually impressed, not only by the quality of product, but by the most amazing customer service and consistent source of seafood knowledge and educational information."

- Meri Lippard, America's Test Kitchen

settings.sub_description: Fresh off the boat Groundfish, Mackerel, Skate - if it's swimming in our local waters and delicious, we've got it
Hiramasa from Australia, King Kampachi from Mexico, Shima Aji and Madai from Japan - we bring in the best in the world
Salmon and trout from top and traceable producers like Loch Duart, Ora King, and Nordic Blu, plus wild Pacific Salmons
The big and the beautiful - all meticulously handled, graded and broken down by our in-house experts
Cured bluefin heart, Fijian sea grapes, fresh Maine sugar kelp, east and west coast uni - we have your next favorite ingredient
Oysters, Clams and Mussels - local, curated and as fresh as can be
A full line of caviars, from OSetra, Siberian and Imperial Gold Kaluga, to Salmon, Trout and Paddlefish roes
Live Sea and Bay Scallops, local Squid, domestic head-on Shrimp, and premium imports

settings.title: Wholesale - Boston, New York and across the nation.
settings.description:
We supply chefs and fishmongers down the street and across the country. Create an account with our wholesale credit application. Get on our newsletter list for daily availability.

Home Delivery - Home cooks can order Wulf's Fish too.

settings.title: How to enter
settings.text:
All orders of $199+ placed now through the end of July 2021 will be automatically entered to win a trip for two to the home of great American seafood  — Boston, Mass.

Other ways to enter and official rules.

settings.title: The Winners will receive:
settings.text:
- Roundtrip airfare for two to Boston Logan Airport from anywhere in the continental United States

- Three nights at the luxurious Boston Harbor Hotel

- $300 dining allowance to sample the city's exciting dining scene

- A private seafood cooking class with Wulf's Fish in-house chefs

The winner will be chosen at random from all qualifying orders placed between June 17, 2021 and July 31, 2021. Employees of Wulf's Fish and their immediate families are not eligible.

settings.title: shop on our online store as usual
settings.description: Items that are available for subscription will have that option clearly marked.

settings.title: Just choose "Subscribe" then "Add to Cart"
settings.description: and continue shopping as usual. All the items you subscribe to in your order will be bundled together into a custom subscription that will automatically ship to you every 30 days. Your credit card will be charged when the order ships out each month.

settings.title: shipping
settings.description: will not be charged if your subscription meets the FREE Shipping minimum for your zone. See our shipping zone chart.

settings.title: Add seasonal items when you want them
settings.description: Due to seasonality and limited availability, we cannot offer subscriptions on all items, but it's easy to add seasonal specialties to ship with your subscription as they become available.

settings.title: You are always free to pause or cancel your subscription
settings.description: at any time without penalty. Log in to your account to update your preferences.

settings.title: If you want more seafood delivered beyond what's in your subscription,
settings.title1: it's now even easier to Add On with our

settings.description: Log in to your account page at wulfsfish.com.
Click on the "Add a Product" button on the top right of your screen.

From there you will be able to add an item to be delivered with your subscription. Either search for the item in the search bar or scroll the pop-up menu for items to add. With this new interface, there's no need to add code "Add On" or send a separate note to Customer Care to flag the addition.
You can now add items as one-time purchases or as recurring additions to your subscription. If an item can be added on a recurring basis, the subscription option will be visible on that item.
You are always free to pause or cancel your subscription at any time without penalty. Log in to your account to update your preferences.

settings.title: Need help?
settings.content: Need help? Contact customercare@wulfsfish.com for assistance or through the chat button on our website.
